IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
R-24 equipped with in-car camera and body-worn camera.
Case# 23-MSP-009386
Defendant: Hanifah Ameena Stafford
Date of Birth: 01/31/1996    
Date of Arrest: 03/15/2023
Time of Arrest: 0319 hours
DUI #: 23-150
Citation #: 3LV0XD0


Certificates and Training
*Trained in administering standardized field sobriety tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration

*Certified Emergency Medical Technician by the Maryland Institute of Emergency Medical Services Systems

*Certified RADAR/LIDAR operator by the Maryland State Police

*Certified License Plate Reader (LPR) operator by the Maryland State Police

Vehicle In Motion (Phase 1) ((See CPL Dunlap Supplement)) 

On March  15th, 2023 at approximately 0330 hours I, Trooper Sigman #7376, currently assigned to the Golden Ring Barrack, was on routine patrol when I was requested by CPL Dunlap to respond to the Barrack to take over the investigation of a suspected impaired driver.

Personal Contact (Phase 2)

I then arrived at the Golden Ring Barrack and observed the suspect, identified by her Maryland driver’s license, as Hanifah Ameena Stafford (01/31/1996) seated in the front passenger seat of CPL Dunlap’s vehicle. Upon opening the door, Stafford immediately became verbally aggressive and cursed at CPL Dunlap and me. Stafford stated that she had back pain and requested to go to the hospital. Baltimore County Ambulance 12 then responded to the Barrack.

While speaking with Stafford, I immediately detected the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from her breath and person, bloodshot glassy eyes, and slurred speech upon conversation. Stafford was then escorted into cell #2 where EMS was awaiting her arrival. While walking into the barrack I observed that Stafford displayed gait ataxia and almost fell over numerous times while walking. Once inside the Cell Stafford continued to curse and threaten CPL Dunlap and me. After being extremely uncooperative with EMS, Stafford stated that she wished to be transported to the hospital for “back pain.”

Stafford was then loaded into Baltimore County Ambulance 12 and transported non-emergency to Franklin Square Hospital. 

Once at the hospital Stafford was wheeled inside and waited on the stretcher in the hallway.

 Pre-Arrest Screening (Phase 3)

I asked Stafford the following questions:

Injuries- “back pain”
Medical conditions- none
Medications- none
Alcoholic beverages- Denies any alcohol consumption
Controlled dangerous substance- denies



Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus (Not completed)

While seated in the stretcher at the hospital I asked Stafford if I could perform Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus testing on her. Stafford told me to “Fuck off” and put her jacket over her face.

The remainder of the standardized field sobriety tests were unable to be performed due to Stafford’s uncooperative and aggressive behavior.



Arrest

Based on the following, I had probable cause to believe Stafford had been driving a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol:

* CPL Dunlap’s vehicle in motion observations
*Strong odor of an alcoholic beverage on Stafford’s breath and person
*Glassy eyes
*slurred speech
*Gait ataxia





At this time I advised Stafford that she was under arrest for DUI. I then handed Stafford a DR15 and began to play the DR15 audio aloud. Stafford threw the DR15 on the floor. I then picked it up and handed it back to her. Stafford continued to place her jacket over her head for the remainder of the DR15 Audio. At the conclusion of the audio I asked Stafford if she would consent to a blood test. Stafford replied “go fuck yourself bitch.” The time of the refusal was 0425 hours. I asked Stafford to sign the refusal. Stafford responded “I ain't signing shit.”



20-Minute Observation Period:

N/A

    

Intoximeter Result:

N/A

Stafford was then issued the appropriate citations as well as a DR15A which she refused to sign. Stafford was then released to the care of Franklin Square Hospital. Prior to leaving the emergency room, I observed a nurse begin to ask Stafford standard medical questions. Stafford began to scream at the nurse stating “fuck off you pussy ass bitch.” Security was then called. I then cleared the hospital and returned to the Golden Ring Barrack.

Once at the Barrack I contacted the Maryland Gun Center in reference to the loaded Smith and Wesson M&P 9 Shield (Serial #JDJ3526) which was recovered from her vehicle. The gun center advised that the handgun was not registered and that Stafford did not have a concealed carry permit in Maryland. 

The handgun was then processed in accordance with agency policy. 

An application for charges was then filed with the Essex Commissioners Office in reference to the multiple firearms violations. The Commissioner then issued a summons for Stafford. 


On March 16th I responded to Stafford’s home address, 2230 Searles Road, and made contact with her. Stafford then signed the summons and was given a copy.

All above events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.

MSP unmarked vehicle Q-21 is equipped with mobile recording devices

• Defendant: Hanifah Ameena Stafford
• Date of Birth: 1/31/1996
• Date of Arrest: 3/15/2023
• Time of Arrest: 0319 hours
• DUI Number: 23-150                                              

CERTIFICATES AND TRAINING
* Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Expert Witness
* Trained in administering standardized field sobriety tests through the Maryland State Police and National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.
* Standardized Field Sobriety Test Instructor
* Completed the Advanced Roadside Impairment Driving Enforcement Program.
* Trained and certified to operate Radar and Lidar through the Maryland State Police.

VEHICLE IN MOTION (PHASE 1)
On Wednesday, March 15, 2023 at approximately 0305 hours, I, Corporal Dunlap of the Maryland State Police – Golden Ring Barrack was on routine patrol in my unmarked MSP vehicle Q-21.  At this time, I was in the area of the inner loop of I-695 near Eastern Blvd.  In front of me, I observed a black 2018 Chevrolet Impala bearing Pennsylvania registration LFW8029. The Chevy was driving evenly down the dotted white lines separating lanes 1 and 2 on I-695. I followed the Chevy as it took exit 39 onto Merritt Blvd. Prior to taking the Merritt Blvd, the Chevy corrected itself fully into lane 2. While on the ramp toward Merritt, the Chevy swerved to the left over the solid yellow line separating lane 1 of the ramp and the left shoulder area. The Chevy began swerving while southbound on Merritt Blvd and was unable to maintain its lane position. The Chevy was apparently driving faster than the 35 mile per hour speed limit. It should be noted that I am trained to estimate vehicle speeds. I activated my Kustom Signals Inc – Golden Eagle II radar in front moving mode and got a speed reading on the Chevy as 64 miles per hour. This radar unit was calibrated and found to be in proper working order at the start and end of my shift. This unit was being used in accordance with my training and per manufacturer’s specifications. The Chevy drove over the dotted white lines from lane 1 into lane 2 by a tire's width as it was southbound on Merritt Blvd near the Wise Ave intersection. All the swerving occurrences lasted for a few seconds. Next, the Chevy made a left turn from Merritt Blvd onto Searles Rd without a turn signal. The Chevy turned onto the wrong side of the road on Searles Rd. The entire Chevy was to the left of the double yellow lines except the passenger side tires. I activated my emergency equipment (audible & visual) and the Chevy accelerated into the alley and finally came to a stop in the rear of 2230 Searles Rd.

PERSONAL CONTACT (PHASE 2)
I approached the Chevy from its driver side and observed the driver (sole occupant) had glassy, bloodshot eyes.  I advised the driver of my: rank, name, ID number, agency and that the stop was being audibly/visually recorded. I also gave the driver multiple reasons (speed, swerving, and not using her turn signal) why I stopped her. The driver was extremely belligerent. Stafford used many obscene and profane words directed toward me. I requested her driver’s license and registration card. I immediately smelled the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from the interior of the vehicle.  The driver advised there was a gun in the vehicle near where she wanted to reach to locate her license. There was also a knife on the front passenger seat. For both of our safety, I asked the driver to step out the vehicle to separate her from where she told me the firearm was. A loaded Smith & Wesson M&P 9 shield semi-automatic handgun was observed in plain sight. The firearm was on the floor within a foot from the gas and brake pedals. I requested assistance from Baltimore County Police Department’s Dundalk Precinct. I identified her by her Maryland driver’s license as Hanifah Ameena Stafford. Stafford located a registration card that expired 12/31/2022. Stafford continued to curse at me. She referred to me as a "n-word". There were 5 members of Stafford's family that approached the traffic stops. Staffords continued to yell toward them to get them excited in an attempt to escalate the situation.

I gave the barrack Stafford’s information to run routine MVA checks on Stafford and her vehicle. I approached the Chevy again and continued to smell the strong odor of an alcoholic beverage emanating from her breath and person. Minutes later, multiple Baltimore County units and Trooper Sigman arrived on scene. Stafford was placed under arrest on gun charges and suspicion of DUI. Stafford advised she had keys in her left pocket. A search revealed it was another knife. While en route to the barrack, Stafford put both her feet on my dashboard. She continued to curse at me. She also requested medical attention while we were on the way to the barrack. I immediately summoned medics to meet us at the barrack. Stafford couldn’t name any injuries/issues that she was experiencing. She just replied “everything” when I tried to help her by locating a specific issue. After Stafford was treated and deemed that everything was well with her she still opted to be transported to the hospital.
Stafford was verbally aggressive and continued to curse at me throughout our interaction. The MSP - Gun Center was contacted and confirmed Stafford didn't have a permit to carry and that the firearm was not registered.

All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.
Case closed by arrest.

TEST FIRE

 

On April 26, 2023, I, D/Sgt. Douglas Forrester # 1174 of the Maryland State Police completed a test-firing of the following firearm by firing two test shots with the firearm.  I am currently assigned to the Golden Ring Barrack located at 8908 Kelso Drive, Essex, MD 21221.  I can be contacted by email at douglas.forrester@maryland.gov or by phone at 410-780-2706.   

 

Make: Smith & Wesson

Model: M&P 9 Shield

Caliber: 9mm

Serial Number: JDJ3526

 

I certify that this firearm is operable and capable of being fired.  The test shots will be forwarded to the Maryland State Police Firearm/Toolmark Unit for NIBIN database entry and storage.  I attended the MSP Forensic Buddy training and successfully completed a competency test.  I successfully completed recertification on December 14, 2022.  

See attached Maryland State Police OTS Firearm Test Fire Certificate Form MSP 21-30.
